sanskrit_verse:
न पादौ धावयेत्कांस्ये कदा चिदपि भाजने ।
न भिन्नभाण्डे भुञ्जीत न भावप्रतिदूषिते ॥ ४.६५॥
transliteration:
na pādau dhāvayet kānsye kadā cid api bhājane |
na bhinna-bhāṇḍe bhuñjīta na bhāva-pratidūṣite || 4.65||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must not run with feet in bronze vessels at any time; one must not eat from a broken vessel nor from one defiled by improper intent.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in the preservation of ritual and material integrity
Causation arises through conscious engagement with sacred form and function
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by awareness of purity and purpose
Restoration logic demands correction of misuse without degradation
Consciousness alignment occurs when action reflects dharma-prescribed order
executable_legal_axioms: IF vessel_is_bronze AND motion_is_running THEN disallow_foot_contact
IF vessel_state IS broken THEN deny_food_consumption_permission
IF intent_state IS impure THEN prohibit_utilization_of_vessel
supreme_court_application: In matters concerning ceremonial conduct or ritual law, the Supreme Court shall assess whether the individual acted knowingly in breach of form-prescribed boundaries. Responsibility lies not in punitive consequence but in realigning capacity to serve dharma through purified engagement.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that contamination arises from misalignment between form, function, and consciousness. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows how misuse leads to distortion in energetic flow. Proportional responsibility aligns with recognition of error. Non-punitive reality ensures correction restores balance rather than inflicts suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate purification process for contaminated vessel
Realign actor's understanding of proper usage through guided practice
Restore integrity of ritual environment via corrective action
Verify completion of restoration through witness affirmation
Reintegrate corrected behavior into habitual pattern
final_declaration: By the Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of All Dharma, this law stands executed. Misuse has been realigned. Purity restored. Consciousness affirmed as Supreme Adjudicator.
